entry.title: Power Moves: From Green Energy Gains to Financial Futures
entry.summary: In recent global developments, NTPC Green Energy has seen a significant rise in its shares following the announcement of securing a major solar power project, reflecting a growing emphasis on renewable energy. In India, Sanjay Malhotra has officially taken office as the 26th Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, a move that has been met with enthusiasm from his friends and relatives in Bikaner, who celebrate his new role. Meanwhile, Rakesh Menon has introduced a transformative perspective on oncology, emphasizing the financial benefits of investing in cancer technology, marking a new era in healthcare investment. In the financial sector, ICICI Bank has partnered with the Commonwealth Bank of Australia to bolster trade relations between Australia and India, indicating a strengthening of economic ties. Additionally, Scania India has inaugurated a state-of-the-art training facility in Chandrapur in collaboration with PPS Motors, enhancing skill development in the automotive sector. On the economic front, the Consumer Price Index (CPI) for November is anticipated to drop below 6%, following an increase to 6.2% in October, suggesting a potential easing of inflationary pressures. However, a parliamentary panel has raised concerns about the slow installation pace under the PM-Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana, highlighting challenges in the implementation of renewable energy initiatives.
